title: Presidential Letter Reporting Military Action Against Iranian Nuclear Facilities
summary: A letter from the President to the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the President Pro Tempore of the Senate providing details about a military strike conducted on June 21, 2025, targeting three nuclear facilities in Iran associated with Iran's nuclear weapons development program. The letter outlines the context and objectives of the operation, which was carried out to protect U.S. national interests.

title: Order Extending Enforcement Delay for Application of the Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act to TikTok
summary: This order, issued by the President, extends the enforcement delay related to the application of the Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act to the TikTok platform, as originally specified in Executive Order 14166 and subsequently extended. The purpose of the order is to prolong the period during which enforcement actions under this order are deferred, continuing the temporary suspension of certain enforcement provisions concerning TikTok.

title: Proclamation Commemorating the 250th Anniversary of the Battle of Bunker Hill
summary: The proclamation celebrates the 250th anniversary of the Battle of Bunker Hill, acknowledging the historical significance of this event in the American Revolutionary War. It recognizes the bravery of the American patriots who fought and emphasizes the enduring importance of this battle in the context of American history.

title: Announcement of Nominations for Assistant Secretary of State for Democracy, Human Rights, and Labor; Assistant Secretary of Veterans Affairs (Information and Technology); Under Secretary for Benefits of the Department of Veterans Affairs; and other positions
summary: The White House announced nominations for multiple federal positions, including Riley Barnes of Texas for the Assistant Secretary of State for Democracy, Human Rights, and Labor; Alan Boehme of California for the Assistant Secretary of Veterans Affairs for Information and Technology; Karen Brazell of Maryland for the Under Secretary for Benefits at the Department of Veterans Affairs; among other appointments to various government roles. The nominations have been sent to the Senate for confirmation.

title: Proclamation Recognizing the Observance of Father's Day 2025
summary: This presidential proclamation acknowledges Father's Day 2025 and highlights the role of fathers in society as custodians of strength, family leaders, and protectors of community safety. It emphasizes appreciation for fathers' love, dedication, and influence in shaping the next generation.

title: Proclamation Declaring June 14, 2025, as Flag Day and Recognizing National Flag Week
summary: This presidential proclamation designates June 14, 2025, as Flag Day, commemorating the anniversary of the adoption of the flag of the United States on June 14, 1777. It also recognizes the observance of National Flag Week, encouraging citizens to honor the history and symbolism of the national flag and promote awareness of its significance in American history and identity.

title: Order Initiating Review of Proposed Acquisition of United States Steel Corporation by Nippon Steel Corporation under the Defense Production Act
summary: This order, issued by the President, utilizes authority under the Defense Production Act of 1950 to initiate a review by the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States concerning the proposed acquisition of United States Steel Corporation by Nippon Steel Corporation. The review is part of the process to assess potential national security implications associated with the proposed transaction.

title: Proclamation Marking the 250th Anniversary of the Establishment of the United States Army
summary: This proclamation commemorates the 250th anniversary of the founding of the United States Army, which was established by the Second Continental Congress on June 14, 1775. It recognizes the Army's role in the nation's history, including its contributions to national security, service, and discipline over the past two and a half centuries.
